settings.heading: What is UTR Sports?
settings.description: The mission of UTR Sports is to connect and grow the sports of tennis and pickleball with accurate global ratings, innovative events, and a global community centered around level-based play.

settings.menubnr_text: In everything we do, we believe in building new models that strengthen and improve player experiences. We believe that everything we do should be about the passion and love of the sport, about the will to improve, to have fun, and to find friendship.

settings.heading: About US
settings.description: Our mission is to grow the sport of tennis by connecting players globally through level-based play, innovative events and a digital marketplace.

settings.heading: THE RATINGs
settings.description: The UTR Tennis Rating is the world’s most accurate tennis rating system. All players are rated on the same 1.00-16.50 point global scale based on daily match results. Equipped with over a decade of expertise, UTR Sports introduced the new UTR Pickleball Rating (UTR-P) in 2023. The UTR-P is a rating for every pickleball player worldwide, from novices to pro players and everyone in between.

Mark Leschly is Chairman and CEO of UTR Sports. Mark is also a Managing Partner/Founder of Iconica Partners and a Managing Partner and owner of Rho Capital Partners, a venture capital and growth equity firm with over $2.5B of assets under management. Mark is a former touring ATP professional tennis player, previously selected to the Danish Davis Cup team. He is a Champions Council member of USTA Player Development and on the board of the USTA Foundation. He is a founding partner and owner of Professional Fighters League (PFL), minority owner in the Los Angeles Football Club (MLS), and the Oklahoma City Dodgers, a AAA Minor League baseball team.

Jeff Blackburn is Senior Vice President of Global Media Entertainment for Amazon.com, managing one of the company’s fastest growing segments – the consolidated media group which encompasses Prime Video, Amazon Studios, Amazon Music, Wondery, Audible, Twitch, and Amazon Games. He previously was Senior Vice President, Worldwide Business Development where he led Amazon’s worldwide Advertising, Digital Video and Music businesses, as well as all Corporate Development/MA activities. Prior to joining Amazon.com, Mr. Blackburn held various positions with Morgan Stanley, Interpublic Group/Marketing Corporation of America, and Bridgewater Associates. He also served as an Associate for Deutsche Bank Technology Group, focusing on Internet software, eCommerce and Media companies.

Ken Hao is a Managing Partner at Silver Lake, a global private equity investor in technology. Ken was a member of original team that started Silver Lake in 1999 and has led large-scale investments in a broad range of tech sectors including e-commerce, electronics, enterprise software and semiconductors. Mr. Hao was a former tennis player at Harvard College and serves on the Executive Council and Board of Overseers at UCSF Health.

Jan Leschly is a former Top 10 ATP player and US Open semifinalist. After his playing career, Mr. Leschly served as CEO of SmithKline Beecham and President and COO of Squibb Corporation. Mr. Leschly has been a Director at Maersk, American Express and Viacom, and he is a past Chairman of the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

Ken Solomon is President of Tennis Channel. Under Mr. Solomon’s leadership, Tennis Channel has become the most watched tennis network, home of the Grand Slams and exclusive US home of the Women’s Tennis Association. Tennis Channel was acquired in 2016 by Sinclair Broadcasting.

John Thornton is professor and director of global leadership at Tsinghua University and Executive Chairman at Barrick Gold. He is a former President of Goldman Sachs, past Chairman of the Board at the Brookings Institution and a former tennis player at Harvard University.

Kelly Forese is President of UTR Sports, having joined the company in the spring of 2020. Kelly has spent the majority of her career as an entrepreneur and operating executive in the software technology space, recently focused in consumer internet, e-commerce and SaaS. Kelly founded and was chairperson/CEO of Registria, a leading SaaS solution enabling businesses to establish, leverage, and maintain relationships directly with customers. After selling Registria, Kelly has been a COO and board member for startups, including Momentous. She’s also served on the board of Cardinal Glass Industries. Kelly has her MBA and Masters in Engineering from Stanford University.

settings.heading: About the
settings.description: UTR Sports is the owner and organizing body of the UTR Pro Tennis Tour (PTT), with responsibility for its Rules and Regulations, Code of Conduct, Tournament Format and related streaming and commercial rights. We partner with Federations and organizers to bring the tournaments to life in order to create a development tour to support players. With fewer events and matches and substantially reduced prize money, aspiring pros are increasingly struggling in pursuit of their dreams. The PTT provides additive and complimentary events to help emerging players and the sport broadly.

settings.heading: What is my Competitive Player Profile?
settings.row_content: Your Competitive Player Profile is the unique profile generated by connecting your Tennis Australia Tennis ID and UTR Rating. With this connection established, your playing history and upcoming match data will be stored securely, enabling access to advanced analytics.

settings.heading: Why do I need a Competitive Player Profile?
settings.row_content: All players competing in Australia should have a Competitive Player Profile established to simplify the process of entering endorsed events and leagues. So whether you play for fun at your local club or professionally on the UTR Pro Tennis Tour, your Competitive Player Profile will ensure you have the best playing experience for your level.

settings.heading: How can I become a Universal Tennis Power User?
settings.row_content: Once you’ve completed your Competitive Player Profile (see above steps), learn more about becoming a Power User at https://www.universaltennis.com/power-players.

settings.heading: What is the UTR Rating?
settings.row_content: The UTR Rating is the world’s most accurate rating system. It promotes fair and competitive play across the tennis world. All players are rated on the same 1.00-16.50 point global scale based on daily match results.
